intro: Layia pentachaeta, commonly known as the narrowleaf cosmos, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Layia pentachaeta is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
